main event: On December 3, 1948, at Chanute Air Force Base in Illinois, a sighting of an unusual aerial object was reported by professional weather observers, including Sgt. [REDACTED]. The object was round, white, and estimated to be over 15,000 feet in altitude. It appeared to be moving upwards at a 15-20 degree angle and reached speeds of over 350 MPH before disappearing within 3 seconds.
interesting points: The object was observed to be moving upwards at a 15-20 degree angle and reached speeds of over 350 MPH before disappearing within 3 seconds.
The sighting was made by professional weather observers and the weather conditions at the time were high scattered clouds with 10 miles of visibility.
No physical evidence of the object's materials was obtained, and no photographs of the object were available.
There were recommendations to change the 'Guide to Investigation of Unidentified Aerial Objects' based on this and other incidents.
The document includes various sightings and evaluations, referencing weather-balloon ascents, and the reliability of observers.
